pageContext.claim: “One of the reasons I'd like to see the interest rates lowered, frankly, is because I'd like to refinance the debt and pay off the debt....But, you know, we're paying higher interest than other countries because of the Fed. If we were paying less, I would do it, and I'd pay off a lot of debt.”
pageContext.analysis: With this comment, Trump demonstrates little understanding of federal finances. Trump is running up $1 trillion in budget deficits a year so he's in no position to start paying down the federal debt; he has significantly added to the national debt. Government debt cannot be refinanced like mortgages. Treasury bonds promise a fixed yield until maturity. The government could issue new bonds and buy the old bonds back, but this wouldn't reduce interest payments at all.
